intro: Psydrax rigidulus, commonly known as the hardy psidium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. The plant is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
